publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:03

did.unittitle: Exhibitions Collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of publications and reports from major international exhibitions, 1867-1904. The Philadelphia Centennial Exhibition, 1876, is a major component of the collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Exhibitions Collection (MS 893). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The largest part of the Exhibitions Collection is made up of catalogues from the Philadelphia Centennial Exhibition of 1876. Although the set is not complete, the catalogues provide a wide overview of the exhibits. They are of two kinds: those on individual industries, crafts and professions, and those for the national exhibits issued by the participating countries. In addition there are pamphlets documenting the organization of the exhibition, with reports by the executive and planning committees (1872-1875), and some official guides and lists of awards. Reports of the Women's Centennial Association of America (1873-1875) describe the activities of women's groups which were formed to help celebrate the Centennial.

Fourteen foreign countries are represented here with catalogues describing their exhibits. These are: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, France, Japan, Netherlands, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland. The United States entries are divided by states. There are also catalogues for exhibits by several national agencies, among them the U.S. Corps of Engineers and the Army Medical Museum.
Miscellaneous catalogues from other world exhibitions (1873-1893) make up the remainder of the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: PHILADELPHIA CENTENNIAL EXHIBITION, 1876

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unbound Volumesis grouped into two parts: 1. Reports on plans for the exhibition and reports and awards for special fields. 2. Catalogues of participating countries arranged alphabetically by country.

Bound Volumesconsists of twelve bound volumes containing catalogues issued by participating countries and individual states of the United States. These collections do not seem to be grouped according to any discernable pattern, and in order to provide access to the volumes, we have listed the titles of the catalogues alphabetically by country and have indicated box and volume number in the margin.

OTHER EXHIBITIONS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of publications received after the original collection of publications from the Philadelphia Centennial Exhibition, 1876 had been arranged. Included is additional material from the Philadelphia Centennial Exhibition as well as publications from other world exhibitions. The material is arranged by accession.
